item.title: NBA Gambling Woes
item.description: ## # A tibble: 25 × 4 ## variable type role source ## <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> ## 1 game_id numeric ID original ## 2 game_date date ID original ## 3 team_short_display_name nominal ID original ## 4 opponent_short_display_name nominal ID original ## 5 season numeric ID original ## 6 opponent_rolling_o_eff numeric predictor original ## 7 opponent_rolling_d_eff numeric predictor original ## 8 opponent_rolling_true_shooting_percentage numeric predictor original ## 9 opponent_nrtg numeric predictor original ## 10 opponent_rolling_orb numeric predictor original ## # … with 15 more rows ## # A tibble: 2 × 3 ## .

item.title: Dogs in the Dawghouse
item.description: Gonzaga left the tournament with tails stuch between their hind legs. If you couldn’t already tell, Gonzaga was not the champion of the NCAA March Madness Tournament this year. If they were, this would be more of a joyful piece in which you could take what I did and maybe recreate it for yourself. However, I would advise that only bits and pieces of work may be worth taking up in future work.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
